abstract: In the “largest ever” investigation of its type in Britain, the alleged insider trading ring is suspected by the Financial Services Authority of making up to $30 million by dealing in the shares of drinks company Scottish & Newcastle and others, The Financial Times reports.
snippet: In the “largest ever” investigation of its type in Britain, the alleged insider trading ring is suspected by the Financial Services Authority of making up to $30 million by dealing in the shares of drinks company Scottish & Newcastle and others, T...
lead_paragraph: In the “largest ever” investigation of its type in Britain, an alleged insider-trading ring is said to be suspected by the government’s Financial Services Authority of making up to £20 million ($30 million) by dealing in the shares of the drinks company Scottish & Newcastle and others, The Financial Times reports.

headline.main: Britain Is Said to Scrutinize S.&N. Trades in Insider Case
